credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
title: Design for a Doorway to the Sacristy of St. Peter's, Rome
medium:
Pen, brown ink, brown and gray wash, graphite
Support: cream laid paper
description: Doorframe is surmounted by a pointed attic pediment, enclosing a medallion, in the center of which is the symbol of Christ (the Chi Rho) amidst a glory of rays. It is framed by palm branches and moldings. On top is a winged cherub's head. A priest standing in the doorway holds a reliquary before a kneeling cleric. Another cleric approaches from the left. Below are two plans.
name: Drawing
